job_detail_text: Corbion develops sustainable solutions to improve the quality of life for people today and for future generations. Are you ready to play a key role in accelerating plant stabilization and performance ramp-up through data-driven insights at Corbion’s largest Lactic Acid plant in Thailand? As Data Analysis & Performance Engineer within the Ramp-Up organization , you are responsible for transforming plant operational data into actionable insights that support troubleshooting, ramp-up of the new plant, stabilization, and performance improvement initiatives. You work within the ramp-up team at the interface between Operations, Global R&D and Process Engineering, ensuring plant performance issues can be quickly detected, analyzed , and understood to support effective technical decisions. Reporting to the Ramp-Up Manager / Technology & Engineering Manager , you contribute to the development of performance monitoring systems, analytical tools, and data models enabling faster identification of production bottlenecks and process instabilities. This role requires strong analytical capability , data handling skills, and the ability to translate industrial data into operational and engineering decisions. Responsibilities • Develop and maintain performance monitoring tools and dashboards for plant ramp-up tracking. • Collect, clean, and structure operational data from process control systems, historians, laboratory systems, and production databases. • Analyze plant performance trends to support troubleshooting and root cause identification. • Support Technologists / process engineers and operations teams by providing data-driven insights during process upsets and improvement initiatives. • Develop performance KPIs and automated reporting supporting ramp-up governance and decision-making. • Identify correlations and process behaviors contributing to plant instability or performance loss. • Support performance testing, plant trials, and improvement initiatives through data analysis and reporting. • Improve data accessibility and quality across departments. • Collaborate with IT and automation teams to improve data collection and reliability. • Contribute to development of digital tools and analytics supporting long-term operational excellence. Train engineers and operations personnel on effective use of performance data tools. Requirements In addition to a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Chemical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields, the successful candidate should have at least 5 years of relevant experience in industrial data analysis or performance monitoring roles. Other qualifications we are looking for: • Strong data analysis and visualization skills. • Experience with industrial data systems ( process historians, SCADA/DCS data, MES systems ) is an advantage. • Good knowledge of data analytics tools such as Python, SQL, Power BI, Tableau , or similar platforms. • Understanding of industrial or chemical manufacturing processes is an advantage. • Ability to translate data insights into operational recommendations. • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. • Ability to work in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams. • Good communication skills with both technical and operational teams. • Good command of written and spoken English. • Living or able to relocate to Rayong area. Corbion Values At Corbion, we look for employees who embody our values: • COURAGE – driving innovation and change. • CARE – for colleagues, customers, and the world we live in. • COLLABORATION – believing success comes through teamwork. • COMMITMENT – delivering on our promises. As part of the Ramp-Up organization, flexibility, collaboration, and ownership are essential in a fast-paced environment. Our Offer We offer competitive remuneration and benefits in an international, innovative, and growing company environment. By joining Corbion, you become part of a company where: • Your work directly impacts plant performance and business success. • You collaborate with diverse international teams. • You benefit from internal technical expertise and technology leadership. • You grow professionally in a demanding and rewarding environment. We actively embrace diversity and inclusion and offer strong global career opportunities.

Inspection Standard Development Assist in organizing inspection data such as Fit Review, Sample/Bulk Inspection Reports, and Risk Logs. Support visual inspection criteria alignment through data tracking and visual libraries. Quality Standard Coordination Ensure quality-related documents (CTQ, CTP, CPK, Tolerance Data) are properly updated, aligned, and traceable across departments. Highlight recurring defects and quality gaps through trend analysis and KPI dashboards. Cross-functional Collaboration Act as a data integration bridge among PD, QA, PQD Engineer, CFA/NCA, IE, Mechanics, and Assembly Technicians. Facilitate communication between development and bulk production teams by packaging key data insights. Evaluation & Reporting Analyze operator performance, validation accuracy, and fit consistency using tools like Pareto, Control Charts, and Fit Summary Tables. Develop real-time dashboards using Power BI or Excel to support defect tracking and readiness monitoring. Production Readiness & Result Focus Prepare technical handover packages, including machine readiness, inspection summaries, and validated operation breakdowns. Track bulk validation milestones (Gold Sample, Pre-Bulk, Bulk) and ensure lessons learned are recorded for future use. At least 2–4 years of experience in a data management, QA, or engineering support role, preferably in garment, footwear, or technical manufacturing. Proven experience with product lifecycle data (sample-to-bulk), version control, inspection tracking, and validation reporting. Experience supporting PD, QA, and manufacturing functions through structured documentation and system-based tracking.
